job_description:
Junior Geophysicist - Fiber-optic Sensing & AI (Fresher)

We are seeking a motivated Junior Geophysicist (recent graduate) to dive into projects involving Distributed Acoustic Sensing (DAS), fiber‑optic sensor data, and Python‑driven AI analysis. You’ll work closely with geophysicists, data scientists, and engineers to drive data‑centric insights and support field deployments.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support data acquisition, preprocessing, and interpretation from fiber‑optic sensing systems (DAS/DTS).
  • Analyze large time‑series datasets using Python (NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, Matplotlib).
  • Collaborate with AI/ML experts to build models for signal classification, event detection, or anomaly identification.
  • Participate in field activities, including deploying sensors, monitoring systems, and validating datasets.
  • Document workflows, results, and technical insights clearly in reports or code comments.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Geophysics, Geoscience, Physics, Engineering, or related discipline.
  • Fundamental understanding of seismic wave behavior and fiber‑optic sensing principles.
  • Basic proficiency in Python and experience with data‑analysis libraries.
  • Interest in machine learning—any exposure to scikit‑learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch is a plus.
  • Excellent analytical thinking, communication skills, and collaborative mindset.

Preferred (Nice-to-Have)

  • Experience with signal processing, time‑series analysis, or seismic inversion methods.
  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and Jupyter notebooks.
  • Willingness and physical ability to participate in occasional fieldwork and travel.

What You’ll Gain

  • Hands‑on experience at the intersection of geophysics, fiber‑optic sensing, and AI.
  • Mentorship from industry professionals and cross‑disciplinary collaboration.
  • Exposure to real‑world problems in energy, infrastructure, and environmental monitoring.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at lakshmi@team.tranzmeo.com
summary: Seeking a Junior Geophysicist to work with fiber-optic sensor data and AI analysis. Responsibilities include data acquisition, analysis using Python, and collaboration with AI/ML experts.

This role combines the strengths of a data scientist with the capabilities of an AI engineer, allowing you to dive deep into data, extract meaningful insights, and then build and deploy cutting-edge Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Generative AI models. You will play a crucial role in transforming raw data into strategic assets and intelligent applications.

Experience Required: 6 Years to 10 Years Location: Appfabs Innovation Open Positions: 3 Employment Type: Full Time

Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Analysis & Insight Generation:
  • Perform in-depth Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in complex datasets.
  • Clean, transform, and prepare data from various sources for analysis and model development.
  • Apply statistical methods and hypothesis testing to validate findings and support data-driven decision-making.

  • Create compelling and interactive BI dashboards (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to visualize data insights and communicate findings to stakeholders.

  • Machine Learning & Deep Learning Model Development:

  • Design, build, train, and evaluate Machine Learning models (e.g., regression, classification, clustering) to solve specific business problems.
  • Develop and optimize Deep Learning models, including CNNs for computer vision tasks and Transformers for Natural Language Processing (NLP).

  • Implement feature engineering techniques to enhance model performance.

  • Generative AI Implementation:

  • Explore and experiment with Large Language Models (LLMs) and other Generative AI techniques.
  • Implement and fine-tune LLMs for specific use cases (e.g., text generation, summarization, Q&A).
  • Develop and integrate Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems using vector databases and embedding models.
  • Apply Prompt Engineering best practices to optimize LLM interactions.
  • Contribute to the development of Agentic AI systems that leverage multiple tools and models.

Required Skills & Experience:

  • Data Science & Analytics:
  • Strong proficiency in Python and its data science libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
  • Proven experience with Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and statistical analysis.
  • Hands-on experience developing BI Dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau.

  • Understanding of data warehousing and data lake concepts.

  • Machine Learning:

  • Solid understanding of various ML algorithms (e.g., Regression, Classification, Clustering, Tree-based models).

  • Experience with model evaluation, validation, and hyperparameter tuning.

  • Deep Learning:

  • Proficiency with Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras, or PyTorch.
  • Experience with CNNs (Convolutional Neural Networks) and computer vision concepts (e.g., OpenCV, object detection).

  • Familiarity with Transformer architectures for NLP tasks.

  • Generative AI:

  • Practical experience with Large Language Models (LLMs).
  • Understanding and application of RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) systems.
  • Experience with Fine-tuning LLMs and Prompt Engineering.

  • Familiarity with frameworks like LangChain or LlamaIndex.

  • Problem-Solving: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong ability to approach complex data challenges.

Good to Have:

  • Experience with cloud-based AI/ML services (e.g., Azure ML, AWS SageMaker, Google Cloud AI Platform).
  • Familiarity with MLOps principles and tools (e.g., MLflow, DVC, CI/CD for models).
  • Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Apache Spark).

Educational Qualification:

Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).

Contact: Interested candidates please share your resume with us at careers@appfabs.in. Please mention the position you are applying for in the subject line.

job_description:
Rebar Detailer

Grid Engineering Services Nila, Technopark Phase I, Technopark Rd, Technopark Campus, 695581 https://gridengineeringservices.com

Closing Date: 06, Aug 2025 Job Published: 05, July 2025 Contact Email: hr@grdeng.com

Brief Description

Rebar detailers are responsible for creating reinforcement shop drawings using CADS RC or other computer-aided design programs. These drawings describe specifications for rebar or other steel construction materials. They develop shop drawings indicating types of rebar or structural reinforcements necessary for a project, whether it's a building construction project or sets of prefabricated components. Drawings include detailed rebar shapes and explanations for how builders plan to use rebar.

Responsibilities:

  • Prepare Shop drawings and Bar bending schedule of reinforced concrete elements.
  • Understand and follow ACI, BS, or IS code-based detailing standards.
  • Produce rebar drawings that conform to industry and company standards for various structures.
  • Ability to manage Structural steel, Architectural drawings will be added an advantages

Preferred Skills

  • Degree in Civil Diploma/B. Tech with 4+ years' experience in Building services industry as a Draftsman
  • Experience in BS codes and standards
  • Experience in working for an international client / projects a plus
  • Experience in BIM (Building information modelling would be a plus
  • Should be able to learn and understand a variety of structures and construction sequence

Location: Technopark, Trivandrum Salary: Between 25,000 to 60,000(Based on skills and experience).
summary: Seeking a Rebar Detailer to create reinforcement shop drawings using CADS RC and adhere to industry standards. The role involves preparing detailed drawings and bar bending schedules.
